alert.note: Alert for Bryce Canyon Country; Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; Central Mountains; Glen Canyon Recreation Area, Lake Powell; Lower Washington County; Sevier Valley; South Central Utah; Southern Mountains; Southwest Utah; Upper Sevier River Valleys; Western Canyonlands; Zion National Park (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 17 at 11:35AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding due to heavy rainfall. * WHERE...A portion of Utah, including the following areas, Central Mountains, Sevier Valley, Bryce Canyon Country, Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity, Glen Canyon Recreation Area/Lake Powell, South Central Utah, Southern Mountains, Upper Sevier River Valleys, Western Canyonlands, Lower Washington County, Southwest Utah and Zion National Park. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall causing flash flooding of slot canyons, normally dry washes, recent burn scars, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flash flooding in urban areas is also possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - An ongoing monsoon surge combined with a series of weather disturbances crossing the area will bring an increased threat of flash flooding to portions of central and southern Utah. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Bryce Canyon Country; Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; Central Mountains; Glen Canyon Recreation Area, Lake Powell; Lower Washington County; Sevier Valley; South Central Utah; Southern Mountains; Southwest Utah; Upper Sevier River Valleys; Western Canyonlands; Zion National Park
